content.description:
Start up the face, pull over the bulge into an obvious right-trending roof, go through the roof and continue up and right to the anchors on Crowbar.

This line is located between Hemp Seed Protein and Crowbar. (P. 80 in the guidebook.)
bolts

One of the classic climbs in the West Kootenays.Clip 3 bolts off the deck, while climbing through slopers to gain the obvious rightfacing corner crack. Power up it into the flake, and then make some reachy moves heading some broken corners that are followed to the top. There is good pro on this climb, but it's a bit fiddly in spots (especially near the top). The crux is harder if you're under 5'4" (roughly). This is pretty much the only warm up for the crag, and not much of a warm up!

blue metolius to #3 camalot. 3 bolts. Anchor has chains

Climb past the first 4 bolts of Skinny Dip to where this route goes diagonally up and right. From here go up and left a few meters then follow slanted features trending up and right on an overhanging shield-like bulge. The crux is getting from the last bolt to the anchor. 

As for Skinny Dip.
bolts

From the top of Fine Print follow a series of steep blocky features to the crux overhang at the 3rd bolt. Above this, move left and climb the wildly exposed slabby arête passing 3 more bolts to the anchor. Lower to the top of Fine Print. Combine Fine Print with this one for a 35m enduro fest.

Start at the top of Fine Print.
bolts.

The Kootenay Crag, home of one the best trad climbs, and the hardest sport climb in the West Kootenays. Routes start at 10d and go to 13b, mostly slightly overhanging sport routes, but several excellent mixed lines as well. Usually you'll have the place to yourself.

This spot holds the kootenays highest concentration of hard climbs and no line-ups.
page 79 in WKRG
